triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio is within the acceptable range for Tier A but needs to be explicitly calculated and confirmed.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify the LTV calculation and ensure it adheres to the policy limit.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier A. The calculated LTV is 91.11%, which is within the acceptable range but should be confirmed for accuracy.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio is within the acceptable range for Tier A but needs to be explicitly calculated and confirmed.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify the DTI calculation and ensure it adheres to the policy limit.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 45% for Tier A. The calculated DTI is 42.5%, which is within the acceptable range but should be confirmed for accuracy.

content.reasoning: The proposal was reviewed against the underwriting policy, focusing on credit risk, asset and loan structure, and affordability. The applicant's credit score places them in Tier A, allowing for a maximum LTV of 110% and a DTI of 45%. The calculated LTV is 91.11%, and the DTI is 42.5%, both within acceptable limits but requiring confirmation. No other significant issues were identified.
